{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3460343,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-17T16:27:49.754Z","cooked":"

Currently, you can do this to bring in vendors:

[tool.robotpy]
robotpy_version = "2024.x.x.x"
robotpy_extras = [
    # "all"
    # "apriltag"
    # "commands2"
    # "cscore"
    # "navx"
    # "pathplannerlib"
    # "phoenix5"
    # "phoenix6"
    # "playingwithfusion"
    # "rev"
    # "romi"
    # "sim"
]

There’s a lot of problems with this approach – in particular, there’s no guarantee that you’re using a particular version. Having the extras mechanism made a lot of sense before the sync mechanism existed, but I think it would make more sense to make users specify their dependencies explicitly in the toml like so:

[tool.robotpy]
robotpy_version = "2024.x.x.x"
requires = [
    "robotpy-ctre==2024.x.x",
    # etc
]

The nice thing about the extras is we put the comment in the toml that tells users what things they could install. Presumably, we could write a tool that could update the toml with specific dependencies (maybe robotpy project-add ctre?) to make this easier for users – and if you know how to write python code, this would be an excellent place to make a contribution!

Please comment here or at Remove robotpy_extras from pyproject.toml · Issue #118 · robotpy/robotpy-installer · GitHub with your thoughts.
